sentence: Final product Key, earring hook, broken piece of a chain, broken earring used as a decorative hanging  Process Rough sketch, material, trial and error, attempt 1, attempt 2  Reflection  As I created my Frakenthing it made me reflect on multiple ways in which things can be used.
My parents do not throw away stuff and try to use it so I think I get this from them as I grew up in a house with a storage room with things such as a broken stereo, old cassettes and fans, etc.
The author uses the word Extension for repair which aptly describes the process of creating this keychain from broken pieces of jewelry.

When I started planning, I decided to use the circular hook which I thought would fit perfectly (Attempt 1) but as I tried to attach the key, I realized the hook that apparently looked perfect could not hold the key.
Moreover, learning through repair is more relevant and timely now that people are trying to move towards practices that are more environment friendly.
